Comment.value:
This script will spawn placeable objects at a randomly-selected waypoint within the area that this trigger is placed. The waypoints must be tagged with "lj_randplcspwn" (Also found on the palette in Special > Custom 4). After a certain amount of time (int BlockTime), the placeable will destroy itself.

Customization (Everything is 0'd out for convenience)
---------------------
Setting the "resref" variable will change which PLC is spawned. By default this is set to Invisible Object, Large. 

The appearance of the placeable can further be customized by setting the "PLCAppearance" variable and referencing placeables.2da

Setting the "DestinationWP" variable will add a transport script, make it usable, and set the waypoint that it will transport you to.

Setting the "ItemResref" variable will add a "give item" script, make it usable, and set the item to be given
    "OncePerReset" variable will only allow 1 item per server reset
    "questname" variable will only give an item while the quest isn't completed. This must exactly match the "questname" variable of the actual quest NPC.

Setting the "MapPin" variable will enable a map pin on the randomly chosen waypoint and set its text to the variable

Setting the "DestroyMessage" variable will add a floating message when the placeable is destroyed
On the Advanced tab, replace <Place text here> with whatever information you wish to appear on the Map of an area.
On the Advanced tab, replace <Place text here> with whatever information you wish to appear on the Map of an area.
On the Advanced tab, replace <Place text here> with whatever information you wish to appear on the Map of an area.
On the Advanced tab, replace <Place text here> with whatever information you wish to appear on the Map of an area.
On the Advanced tab, replace <Place text here> with whatever information you wish to appear on the Map of an area.

This is the default waypoint you may place to set a patrol path for a creature or NPC.
1. Create the creature and either use its current Tag or fill in a new one.
2. Place or make sure the WalkWayPoints() is within the body of the On Spawn script for the creature.
3. Place a series of waypoints along the route you wish the creature to walk.
4. Select all of the newly created waypoints and right click. Choose the Create Set option.
5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.

This is the default waypoint you may place to set a patrol path for a creature or NPC.
1. Create the creature and either use its current Tag or fill in a new one.
2. Place or make sure the WalkWayPoints() is within the body of the On Spawn script for the creature.
3. Place a series of waypoints along the route you wish the creature to walk.
4. Select all of the newly created waypoints and right click. Choose the Create Set option.
5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.

Place this waypoint in an area as a target for the spawns scripts. You can place as many of them as you want. The spawn scripts pick up to 4 spawnpoints an area to spawn creatures on as long as there's one or more PCs in the area.
